experiences of mature and gifted adults, people
who have made, and continue to make, some recog¬
nizable contribution to mankind. The spectrum of
coverage could touch: The Natural Sciences -
Education - Space Sciences - Social Sciences -
Communications Arts and Technology. This kind of
program series is not of the "Youth Wants to Know"
variety. It is, rather, another kind of idea,
reflecting more of the challenge which creative
thinking imposes on the individual. It exposes the
disciplines inherent in the creative processes,
whether that involvement be in research, the practice
of science, or in the more monastic exercises of
discipline required for creative expression in writing,
music, printing, etc.
